intro: Verbesina suncho, commonly known as suncho or golden crownbeard, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, creating a striking visual display. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Verbesina suncho is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
